title: Becoming Jane writing
content:
In the movie _Becoming Jane,_ a “hand double” is used to do the writing of Jane Austen’s letters.  
Whoever the calligrapher is, it’s absolutely stunning to see a big screen close-up of the writing taking place—the style is spot-on.

author: Nick Shinn

comments.content: I remember Brody Neuenschwander talking about being the ’hand double’ for John Gielgud’s Prospero in Peter Greenaway’s _Prospero’s Books_. Apparently Gielgud had very fine hands, and Brody was embarassed that his own were not as elegant. But his calligraphy was stunning. I remember watching a clip from the beginning of the film during the 1995 ATypI conference in Barcelona, and there was an audible gasp of admiration at the rapid execution of a particularly elegant swash d.
